intro: Marcgravia polyantha subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western arrowroot. It is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and striking, spadix-like inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
